members.description: These are all the "native" node properties

property.name: Parent
property.description: A reference to the node's parent

property.name: Id
property.description: The id of the node in Umbraco

property.name: TemplateId
property.description: If a template has been assigned, its id is returned here.

property.name: Url
property.description: The absolute URL (e.g. /my/page/about-url/) of the content item. Whenever you need to link to a page, this is what you should use.
property.note: If the config setting <useDomainPrefixes> in umbracoSetting.config is true, this will return a full URL with protocol, hostname & port etc.

description.p: A URL-safe version of the node's name, e.g. for a document named About Us the UrlName property would be generated as about-us.
Also good for anchor links to various sections on a page (see code example)

property.name: DocumentTypeAlias
property.description: Returns the alias of the Document Type used by this content item.

property.name: Path
property.description: A CSV string of the ids of the nodes in the ancestor axis, e.g.: "-1,1060,2590"

function.name: GetTemplateAlias
function.description: The alias of the assigned template (if any).

function.name: GetPropertyValue
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property. If the recursive argument is true, the value is taken from the first ancestor (or the node itself) that has a value for the property.

function.name: GetPropertyValue
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property. If the recursive argument is true, the value is taken from the first ancestor (or the node itself) that has a value for the property.

function.name: GetPropertyValue
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property. If the recursive argument is true, the value is taken from the first ancestor (or the node itself) that has a value for the property.

function.name: GetPropertyValue
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property. If the recursive argument is true, the value is taken from the first ancestor (or the node itself) that has a value for the property.

function.name: GetPropertyValue
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property. If the recursive argument is true, the value is taken from the first ancestor (or the node itself) that has a value for the property.

function.name: GetPropertyValue<T>
function.description: Returns the value of the specified property as the type T.

function.name: GetPropertyValue<T>
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property.

function.name: GetPropertyValue<T>
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property.

function.name: GetPropertyValue<T>
function.description: Outputs the value of the specified property.
